metadata.title: CVE-2019-6976 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
libvips before 8.7.4 generates output images from uninitialized memory locations when processing corrupted input image data because iofuncs/memory.c does not zero out allocated memory. This can result in leaking raw process memory contents through the output image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-6976` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-vips-8.0 - 8.7.4-1
libvips-tools - 8.7.4-1
libvips42 - 8.7.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vips package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.7.4-1').
